argument.name: code
argument.description: The Xbasic code to be run placed into a character string.

argument.name: flags
argument.description: "R" = If you register duplicate code, Alpha Anywhere only executes the code once. "N" = Use this flag when issuing the command from a modal dialog box.

page.description: Run code next time xbasic is not busy executing - flags R-eapeat suppress,N-ested idles. the supress repeats flag doesn't add the code if the exact same code is already scheduled.
page.discussion: The ON_XBASIC_IDLE() function register Xbasic code that will be run the next time Alpha Anywhere is idle. (i.e. after any scripts that are running asynchronously have finished). You would typically use this command if you have script that is running into timing problems. Limitations:Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: This example calls on_xbasic_idle() twice with the same code, but the code block executes only once (assuming that there was no idle after the first on_xbasic_idle() was called, which there wouldn't have been).
